required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rib Microtia and the Erector Spinae Plane (ESP) Block
clinical_study.official_title: Erector Spinae Plane Block for Rib Cartilage Graft Reconstruction Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The erector spinae plane block is a novel regional anesthetic technique that allows for analgesia of the thorax and abdomen with a peripheral nerve block. This study is being performed to assess the effectiveness of this technique in reducing post-operative pain scores and opiate requirements in pediatric and adult patients undergoing rib cartilage grafting surgeries.

primary_outcome.measure: Opiate Intake in Morphine Equivalents in Both Control and Treatment Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of procedure and postoperative recovery (throughout study completion, typically 4-5 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluating Pain Scores Using 0-10 Numeric Pain Scale (0=No Pain, 10=Worst Pain)
primary_outcome.description: Scale will be used to asses pain initially prior to the procedure and postoperatively approximately every 6 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluating Pain Scores Using Wong-Baker FACES Pain Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: Scale will be used to asses pain initially prior to the procedure and postoperatively approximately every 6 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluating Pain Scores Using Faces, Legs, Activity, Cry, and Consolability (FLACC) Scale
primary_outcome.description: Scale will be used to asses pain initially prior to the procedure and postoperatively approximately every 6 hours.

intervention.description: Erector Spinae Plane block for patents undergoing rib cartilage grafting surgeries

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 2-17
- Able to consent (if greater than 7 years) and have parental consent
- Pediatric patients undergoing rib cartilage resection surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who do not consent or have parental consent
- Patients who are clinically unstable or requires urgent/emergent intervention

reference.citation: Forero M, Rajarathinam M, Adhikary S, Chin KJ. Erector spinae plane (ESP) block in the management of post thoracotomy pain syndrome: A case series. Scand J Pain. 2017 Oct;17:325-329. doi: 10.1016/j.sjpain.2017.08.013. Epub 2017 Sep 12.

Luftig J, Mantuani D, Herring AA, Dixon B, Clattenburg E, Nagdev A. Successful emergency pain control for posterior rib fractures with ultrasound-guided erector spinae plane block. Am J Emerg Med. 2018 Aug;36(8):1391-1396. doi: 10.1016/j.ajem.2017.12.060. Epub 2017 Dec 28.
Hamilton DL, Manickam B. Erector spinae plane block for pain relief in rib fractures. Br J Anaesth. 2017 Mar 1;118(3):474-475. doi: 10.1093/bja/aex013.
